## Dataset Description

:::{.fragment}
**Data Source & Preparation:**  

<div style="font-size: 0.60em">

- Source: *Cost of International Education* dataset (USD, 2023)
- Filtered for Master of Computer Science programs
- Checked for missing values and correct types
- Duplicates resolved by averaging affordability ratios

</div>
:::

:::{.fragment}
**Key Variables**

<div style="font-size: 0.60em">

| Variable name      | Description                    | Unit       |
|--------------------|--------------------------------|------------|
| Program duration   | Total program length           | Years      |
| Tuition            | Total program tuition cost     | USD        |
| Rent               | Monthly rent                   | USD/Month  |
| Living cost index  | Standardized cost of living    | Index      |
| Visa fees          | Student visa fee               | USD        |
| Insurance          | Annual insurance fee           | USD        |

</div>
:::

---

## Methods

:::{.fragment}
**Cost Projection**  

<div style="font-size: 0.60em">

- Tuition and rent projected to 2025 using 4.75% annual inflation (IMF forecasts for advanced economies)
  + Annual Tuition = Tuition_USD / Duration_Years × 1.0475
  + Annual Rent = Rent_USD × 12 × 1.0475
  
- Other Living Cost not projected, but adjusted by each university’s local living cost index
  + Living Cost = \$17,736 × (Living_Cost_Index / 100)
  + Baseline \$17,736 from NYU’s 2024–25 Cost of Attendance (excludes housing and health insurance)
  
- Visa and insurance excluded (minor, variable)

</div>
:::

:::{.fragment}
**Budget & Affordability Calculation**  

<div style="font-size: 0.60em">

- 2023 U.S. median household income (\$80,160, U.S. Census Bureau) projected to 2025 with 2.8% compound annual growth
- 50% of projected income assumed available for education
- Affordability Ratio = Student Budget (2025) / Total Yearly Cost (2025)
- Ratio > 1 means affordable for a U.S. median-income household

</div>
:::

## Methods (Cont’d)

**Example Figure**

```{r fig-affordability, fig.height=17, fig.width=13}
#| fig-cap: "<span style='font-size:0.8em;'> Affordability Ratios for Master of Computer Science Programs by University in 2025</span>"
#| fig-width: 10
#| fig-height: 15
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(here)

# Read in dataset
international_stu_cost <- read_csv(here( "data/International_Education_Costs.csv" ))

# 1. Calculate yearly costs in 2023 and check proportion of one-off fees
master_comsci_2023 <- international_stu_cost |>
  filter( Program == "Computer Science",
          Level == "Master"
          ) |>
  mutate(
    annual_tuition = Tuition_USD / Duration_Years,
    annual_rent = Rent_USD * 12,
    other_living_cost = ( Living_Cost_Index / 100 ) * 17736,
    one_off_fees = Visa_Fee_USD + Insurance_USD,
    Total_Yearly_Costs = annual_tuition + annual_rent + other_living_cost + one_off_fees,
    One_off_fees_portion = one_off_fees / Total_Yearly_Costs
      ) |>
  select(!c( Exchange_Rate, Insurance_USD, Visa_Fee_USD, Rent_USD, Living_Cost_Index, Tuition_USD, Duration_Years ))

# 2. Project 2023 costs to 2025 and define 2025 cost for each institution
master_comsci_2025 <- master_comsci_2023 |>
  mutate(
    Total_2023_Costs = annual_tuition + annual_rent,
    Total_2025_Costs = (Total_2023_Costs * 1.0475) + other_living_cost
    ) |>
  select(!c( annual_tuition,  annual_rent, other_living_cost, one_off_fees, Total_Yearly_Costs, One_off_fees_portion )
         )
    
# 3. Project 2023 income to 2025 and define student budget
base_income_2023    <- 80610   # from U.S. Census Bureau
income_2025         <- base_income_2023 * (1 + 0.028)^2
Student_Budget_2025 <- 0.5 * income_2025

# 4. Summarise by university and compute affordability ratio
affordability_ratio <- master_comsci_2025 |>
  mutate(
    StudentBudget2025  = Student_Budget_2025,
    AffordabilityRatio = StudentBudget2025 / Total_2025_Costs
    ) |>
  group_by( University ) |>
  summarise( AffordabilityRatio = mean( AffordabilityRatio, na.rm = TRUE), 
             .groups = "drop") |>
  arrange( AffordabilityRatio )

afford_plot <- affordability_ratio |>
  mutate(
    University = factor( University, levels = unique( University )),
    Highlight  = if_else( University == "Monash University", "Monash", "Other"))

ggplot(afford_plot, aes(x = University, 
                        y = AffordabilityRatio, 
                        fill = Highlight)) +
  geom_col() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Monash" = "firebrick", 
                               "Other" = "grey80")) +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(
    data = afford_plot |>
      filter(University == "Monash University"),
    aes(label = "Monash University", y = AffordabilityRatio),
    hjust = -0.1,            
    color = "firebrick",
    fontface = "bold",
    size = 10
  ) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 1, 
             linetype = "dashed", 
             color = "darkblue", 
             linewidth = 1) +
  labs(
    x = "University",
    y = "Affordability Ratio" 
    ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 9),
    legend.position = "none"
    )
```
